oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Discussion - Impact of the recordings You Can Make It If You Try and Everlasting Love - 2004-04-24
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Panel discussion about the recordings "You Can Make It If You Try" and "Everlasting Love" from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on April 24, 2004. In support of the exhibit "Night Train to Nashville: Music City Rhythm and Blues".
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ted Jarrett; Levert Allison; Robert Knight; Buzz Cason; Mac Gayden;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Recording begins in progress. Includes questions from the audience. Opening comments by Michael Gray. Introduction of participants including Ted Jarrett, Levert Allison, Robert Knight, Buzz Cason, Mac Gayden. Includes questions from the audience. Subjects include; You Can Make It If You Try -- Ted Jarrett inspiration for the song -- Gene Allison's contributions -- History of the records release -- Levert Allison working with his brother Gene -- Story about Levert singing in Gene's place -- Gene switching from gospel to secular music -- Everlasting Love -- Mac Gayden musical beginnings -- Buzz Cason musical beginnings -- Ernie's Record Mart -- Mac with Ted Jarrett songwriter story -- Ted Jarrett with Sam Cooke quote about Gene Allison -- History of how the song came together -- Robert Knight's recollections of the recording session and the song -- Mac's story about how the record broke nationally -- What these records success meant to the Nashville community --
Impact on Robert Knight -- Impact on Ted Jarrett -- Story about the song It's Love Baby (24 Hours A Day) -- Musical arrangement of Everlasting Love -- Closing comments.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Jarrett, Ted; Allison, Levert; Knight, Robert, 1945-; Cason, Buzz; Gayden, Mac;
